intro: Labatia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered labatia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small, usually pink or white, and are clustered in racemes. Labatia parviflora is known for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its delicate blooms.
